intro: Chaenactis glabriuscula var. glabriuscula, commonly known as the Desert蒲公英, is a low-growing, flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. The plant typically thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, such as deserts and rocky soils. It has a compact growth habit with a rosette of basal leaves and produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Its botanical features make it well-adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions.
